events.name: Learn about Google Cloud at Google Denmark
events.description:
Welcome to the first Google Developer Group Cloud in Copenhagen. This is really exciting as this will be a group focusing on the many things that happen in Cloud and on the Google Cloud platform. We will focus on learning and talking use-cases for the exciting solutions in Machine Learning with Tensorflow and hosting with Kubernetes and Serverless.

Time schedule:
17:00 Doors open
17:30 Welcome to GDG Cloud - Kevin Simper
17:40 Welcome from Google Denmark - Alejandro Montenegro
17:50 First presentation - Running on the Google Cloud platform - Kevin Simper
18:20 Snacks and something to drink
18:35 How we use Google Cloud at Hypefactors - Viet Yen Nguyen https://hypefactors.com/
19:05 Raffle with a cool prize
19:15 Socialize with other Google Cloud users
20:00 Thank you for today!

What is GDG Cloud Copenhagen?
It is a meetup group that is organized by the community and helped by Google with resources to provide the best experience for the community in Copenhagen to learn about cloud and the Google Cloud platform.

Can I present something at the meetup?
Yes, you are very welcome to come and present your ideas/solutions. We really admire and actively promote talks that help the community to get a new look on something or see how something is used in other companies!

Friendly regards
The GDG Cloud organizers
Kevin

events.name: Google Cloud Onboard - Build what's next
events.description:
Google is putting on a free event about getting onboard the Google Cloud platform with several modules covering Google Kubernetes Engine and Google BigQuery.

If you are interested in Google Cloud this is something you should check out! They had an event similar last year which was great.

http://bit.ly/2INaDEY

Full disclosure:
I am not part of organizing this event and I do not get anything for promoting this event.

events.name: Learn Kubernetes - Best practices and showcases
events.description:
Learn about using Kubernetes in production. We will have 3 talks about using Kubernetes in the real world and how you can benefit and improve your workflows. It is really exciting how Kubernetes makes many things easy. From the outside it can look difficult to get started with but join us on the 7th May to hear how other got started!

Time schedule:
17:00 Doors open
17:30 Welcome to GDG Cloud - Kevin Simper
17:40 How we use Kubernetes at our Company
18:10 Snacks and something to drink
18:30 Kubernetes best practices in Production
19:00 Quick break
19:15 Your talk?
19:45 Socialize with other Google Cloud users
20:00 Thank you for today!

What is GDG Cloud Copenhagen?
It is a meetup group that is organized by the community and helped by Google with resources to provide the best experience for the community in Copenhagen to learn about cloud and the Google Cloud platform.

Can I present something at the meetup?
Yes, you are very welcome to come and present your ideas/solutions. We really admire and actively promote talks that help the community to get a new look on something or see how something is used in other companies!

Check out the Google Cloud Onboard on the 22th May in Copenhagen, really exciting full day event! http://bit.ly/2GsfuWL

Friendly regards
The GDG Cloud organizer
Kevin

events.name: Introduction to Kubernetes workshop - Sign up required
events.description:
Join this workshop to learn Kubernetes with help and practical real-world exercises. Kubernetes is an open-source tool that has the power to manage companies development. Read the description to get all details.

In this workshop we will go through the following with Kubernetes:
- How to setup
- How to securely use it
- How to deploy manually
- How to setup Continuous Deployment
- How to setup secrets
- How to scale your app
- How to do debug your app

This is going to be a paid workshop. It is also non-profit and all proceeds will be donated to R√∏de Kors.
Students can apply to attend for free!

You will get a printed Kubernetes cheatsheet and also have all the exercises available to take home.

Schedule:
17:00 Doors Open
17:30 Welcome
17:40 Kubernetes Introduction: How to get started?
18:00 Exercises with Kubernetes
18:30 Sandwiches and drinks
18:50 Kubernetes in Production introduction.
19:10 Exercises for deploying Kubernetes
20:30 Follow up talk and networking!

Prices for attending:
First 10 tickets: 75 kroners - sign up here: https://goo.gl/forms/gjJMEDS5Ngnalgsu2
Rest 15 tickets: 85 kroners.
Students: For free, apply here: Limited to 5 seats! https://goo.gl/forms/vwDGGJ0TgpdXUcYh1

Why does it cost money?
The money will cover the food and drink costs, and print out the materials that you get. All proceeds from the event will be donated to Red Cross! The budget will be shared in an open spreadsheet. I also want to have an event where you will not be hungry or thirsty while learning.
Thanks to FoundersHouse for allowing us to loan the location for free!

Why are you doing this?
I really think that Kubernetes is a great product that is helping companies around the world grow and scale faster. That makes it extremely valuable for you and others to learn how to use it. Helping raise money for the Red Cross only makes this experience better.

Here are reviews from previous workshops I have done:
2018: https://www.meetup.com/Docker-Copenhagen/events/251794160/
2018: https://www.meetup.com/Docker-Copenhagen/events/248502824/
2017: https://www.meetup.com/Docker-Copenhagen/events/241287581/
2016: https://www.meetup.com/Docker-Copenhagen/events/234499942/

What is Kubernetes?
If you want a quick introduction to Kubernetes you can watch my tutorial at Youtube that I have made. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6NG_cUeuNhU

Friendly regards
Kevin

If you have any questions please reach out to me either here or on mail. [masked]

events.name: CloudFest - One-day event about Cloud and Machine Learning

venue.name: The Digital Learning House (Google Succes Online)

events.description:
We are organizing a one-day CloudFest, similar to DevFest, about the Cloud and Machine Learning and what it offers.

We want to bring people together for a day of in-depth knowledge and experience sharing, with stories about Cloud Native tools and Google Cloud. Meet others who focus on making better solutions with Cloud offerings.

It is going to be at Google Success Online at N√∏rrebrogade which is a new place has opened.

Have you done something interesting with the Cloud or Machine Learning, submit a proposal to give a talk or write us an email, we will reach out to you quickly!
https://cloudfest.dk/#callforspeakers

You can find all the information here:
https://cloudfest.dk

If you are a student you can also apply to get a ticket by filling out the form here:
https://cloudfest.dk/#diversity

Friendly regards
Kevin, Cem, Zoey

events.name: Learn Tensorflow/Keras machine learning - Workshop
events.description:
In this workshop you will learn how to get started with Machine Learning on your computer. This workshop will be together with Nicholai St√•lung who has experience and have developed solutions with Keras, which is a framework ontop of Tensorflow. We have prepared materials that we will guide you through! You can read more about Keras and take a peek at what we will look at. https://keras.io/

Find Nicholai St√•ling here online and connect with him before:
https://www.linkedin.com/in/nicholai-st%C3%A5lung-a8497565/

Sign up is required! This is going to be a paid non-profit workshop and all proceeds will be donated to R√∏de Kors. We do this to avoid food waste, and overbooking to ensure really high quality events.

In this workshop we will go through the following with Machine Learning:
Learn what Keras and Notebooks are
How to set up Keras on your computer
How to run your first notebook
How to make a prediction with your ML Model
Steps to continue learning Machine Learning

Schedule:
17:00 Doors Open
17:30 Welcome
17:35 Introduction to Machine Learning with Keras - Nicholai St√•lung
18:00 Exercises with Keras and Notebooks
18:30 Pizza and drinks
18:50 Train your first Machine Learning model
19:10 Exercises for predicting sales prices with Keras
20:30 Follow up talk and networking!

Prices for attending:
First 5 tickets: 75 kroners
Rest 5 tickets: 85 kroners
Students: For free

https://ti.to/gdg-cloud-copenhagen/6-dec-machine-learning-workshop

Why does it cost money?
The money will cover the food and drink costs, and print out the materials that you get. All proceeds from the event will be donated to Red Cross! The budget will be shared in an open spreadsheet. I also want to have an event where you will not be hungry or thirsty while learning.
Thanks to FoundersHouse for allowing us to loan the location for free!

Why are we organizing this?
Machine Learning has gone from something really difficult to something that everyone can learn, and learning together with others makes it a more fun experience.Helping raise money for the Red Cross only makes this experience better.

Here are reviews from previous workshops I have done:

What is Machine Learning?
Machine Learning is a broad set of techniques to take high quality data and predict new results base on previous results very simply explained. The wikipedia article gives a really good introduction https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Machine_learning
https://www.reddit.com/r/explainlikeimfive/comments/4v3u4l/eli5_what_is_machine_learning/

Friendly regards
Kevin and Nicholai

If you have any questions please reach out to me either here or on mail. [masked]

events.name: Learn about Google Cloud Functions from Martin Omander
events.description:
Do you want to learn more about Google Cloud Functions? Martin Omander, Google Cloud Developer Advocate, will be joining us on the 20th December from California to speak about his experience with Google Cloud Functions.

He also told me that he want to give away a Google Home Mini to one lucky attendee!

Time schedule:
17:00 Doors open
17:30 Welcome to GDG Cloud - Kevin Simper
17:40 Focus on your code, not infrastructure, with Google Cloud Functions - Martin Omander
18:10 Snacks and something to drink
18:35 Google Cloud Function workshop - try it on your own computer!
19:30 Raflle, win a Google Home Mini
20:00 Thank you for today!

Title: Focus on your code, not infrastructure, with Google Cloud Functions
Description:
In this talk, we will follow the story of the fictional startup "In Jest", publishers of an app that tells jokes. At first, the developers at "In Jest" need to get a minimum viable product up and running in an hour. As their business grows they will have to integrate with Google Sheets, databases, analytics systems, marketing systems and so on. We will see the 100 lines of code needed to make this happen, without having to worry the team about servers and data centers.

https://twitter.com/martinomander
https://martinomander.com/

What is GDG Cloud Copenhagen?
It is a meetup group that is organized by the community and helped by Google with resources to provide the best experience for the community in Copenhagen to learn about cloud and the Google Cloud platform.

Can I present something at the meetup?
Yes, you are very welcome to come and present your ideas/solutions. We really admire and actively promote talks that help the community to get a new look on something or see how something is used in other companies!

Friendly regards
The GDG Cloud organizers
Kevin

events.name: February Cloud Meeting
events.description:
Hey friends, happy new year, another year in the clouds are ahead of us! üòÑCome join us for a evening where we will talk about Google Cloud and what exciting things we can do this year!

Time schedule:
18:00 Doors open
18:30 Welcome to GDG Cloud
18:35 Debugging HTTP traffic in full detail on GKE - Niels Martin S√∏holm Jensen
19:00 Snacks and something to drink
19:20 Monitoring with Prometheus and Grafana - Kevin Simper
19:55 Break
20:10 Lightning talk - You?
20:00 Thank you for today!

Niels Martin S√∏holm - Debugging HTTP traffic in full detail on GKE
- As our infrastructure becomes more distributed and abstract we often find that low-level debugging becomes harder. Occasionally we run into issues that can only be resolved by diving down into the details. This talk is about a challenge which led to a hypothesis that could only be verified by logging full HTTP requests from a GKE cluster. I will show you how we went about that with no third-party systems and with safe handling of customer data. Additionally, I will talk a bit about our systems and what it was like to start a tiny company up from scratch on GCloud.

What is GDG Cloud Copenhagen?
It is a meetup group that is organized by the community and helped by Google with resources to provide the best experience for the community in Copenhagen to learn about cloud and the Google Cloud platform.

Can I present something at the meetup?
Yes, you are very welcome to come and present your ideas/solutions. We really admire and actively promote talks that help the community to get a new look at something or see how something is used in other companies!

Friendly regards
GDG Cloud organizer
Kevin

events.name: Cloud Native workshop - From zero to full speed with Kubernetes - Morning
events.description:
Join this workshop and get started with Cloud Native. We are going to deploy an application from scratch to Google Cloud Kubernetes Engine and learn best practices. Kubernetes is right now the best tool for any company to adopt because it gives you all the tools to go fast without being tied to something that can not scale or grow as your application becomes larger.

https://ti.to/gdg-cloud-copenhagen/cloud-native-workshop-kubernetes

What do I want to cover:
1. Kubernetes
2. Google CloudBuild
3. Container Registry
4. Docker Multistage - Secret management
5. Google Cloud Stackdriver
6. Google Cloud IAM together with Kubernetes
7. Environments - Production, staging, dev, review?
8. How to debug the cloud:
- Monitoring
- Kubernetes
- Logging

To attend this workshop you should already have:
- played around with docker
- used github
- used the terminal
- have a Google Cloud account

This is going to be a paid workshop. It is also non-profit and all proceeds will be donated to R√∏de Kors.
https://ti.to/gdg-cloud-copenhagen/cloud-native-workshop-kubernetes

You will get a printed Kubernetes cheatsheet and also have all the exercises available to take home.

Schedule:
9:00 Welcome and introduction
What are we going to cover and why is it important
9:10 Part 1
10:00 Break
10:10 Part 2
11:00 Break
11:05 Part 3
11:45 Lunch - Drink and Sandwich
12:10 Part 4
13:00 Summary - What did we learn
13:00 See you next time!

Prices for attending: 30 dkk

Why does it cost money?
The money will cover the food and drink costs, and print out the materials that you get. All proceeds from the event will be donated to Red Cross! The budget will be shared in an open spreadsheet. I also want to have an event where you will not be hungry or thirsty while learning. The location and drinks are helped by Google.

Why are you doing this?
I really think that Kubernetes is a great tool that is helping developer grow and scale their application. I am not working for Google or paid by Google, I am only doing this because I think it is fun to teach and help! And helping raise money for the Red Cross only makes this experience better.

Here are reviews from previous workshops I have done:

events.name: June Cloud meetup - Stream Processing & Tensorflow
events.description:
GDG Cloud Copenhagen summer meetup
Summer is here! How about spending it inside with like-minded people, learning about Google Cloud?

A few years ago, moving data between applications and datastores included expensive monolithic stacks from large software vendors with little flexibility. Now with frameworks such as Apache Beam and Apache Airflow, we can schedule and run data processing jobs for both streaming and batch with the same underlying code. The first presentation demonstrates how to setup a multi-step transformation pipeline with Apache Beam in Dataflow that saves the results to BigQuery.

Computas provides beer, drinks, snacks and a bit to eat.

Agenda
17:00-17:50 Doors open
17:50:18:00 Welcome
18:00-18:40 Data ingestion with Apache Beam on Google Cloud w/Rustam Mehmandarov ‚Äì Java Champion, Leader of JavaZone and Chief Engineer at Computas
19:00-19:30 Snack and drinks
19:30-20:10 Writing custom TensorFlow operations on Google Cloud? - Kasper Marstal
20:00-20:30 Socializing and thanks for this time!

Kasper Marstal will be speaking about:
Writing custom TensorFlow operations on Google Cloud?
TensorFlow is one of the most popular frameworks for machine learning, but what if your data cannot be directly represented by a TensorFlow tensor? The second talk will take a deep dive into the internals of TensorFlow and show you how to implement a custom C++ operation for medical image processing and deploy it on Google Cloud. This approach allows you to write concise code in Python and performance critical code in C++ whilst taking advantage of Google's compute infrastructure.

What is GDG Cloud Copenhagen?
It is a meetup group that is organized by the community and supported by Google sometimes with resources. We are a group that is like to use Google Cloud platform and meet like-minded and talk about how we can do things smarter.

Can I present something at the meetup?
Yes, you are very welcome to come and present your ideas/solutions. We really appreciate and actively promote talks that help the community to get a new look at something or see how something is used in other companies! Reach out here on meetup or on email!

Looking forward to see you,
Kevin, Mads, Michael

events.name: Serverless meetup - CloudRun and AutoML
events.description:
Hi friends, let us meet and talk about serverless, a lot of interesting things has happened in this space. Cloud Run is a new product from Google Cloud and even multiple serverless machine learning product has been launched.

Agenda
17:00-17:50 Doors open
17:50:18:00 Welcome
18:00-18:40 Serverless Containers: a marriage made in heaven - Martin Omander
19:00-19:30 Snack and drinks
19:30-20:00 Google Cloud NLP and AutoML Tables - Nicholai St√•lung
20:00-20:30 Socializing and thanks for this time!

----

Martin Omander works for Google in Mountain View, California. His job in the Developer Relations team is to help developers build better software, and improve Google‚Äôs Cloud Platform to make it even better for that purpose. In his spare time he manages to sneak in some game programming.

Serverless Containers: a marriage made in heaven
In this talk you will hear the story of how a chain of pet clinics started their journey from a legacy system to a container-based and serverless system on Google Cloud Platform, the code they wrote, and the benefits they reaped. You will also learn how you can embark on that journey with your organization, and achieve safer deployments and lower cost if you already have.

As developers we used to have to choose between:
- Containers: move software from developers' machines to the cloud with confidence.
- Serverless: only pay for the computing you actually use.
Come and see how to achieve both!

---

What is GDG Cloud Copenhagen?
It is a meetup group that is organized by the community and supported by Google sometimes with resources. We are a group that is like to use Google Cloud platform and meet like-minded and talk about how we can do things smarter.

Can I present something at the meetup?
Yes, you are very welcome to come and present your ideas/solutions. We really appreciate and actively promote talks that help the community to get a new look at something or see how something is used in other companies! Reach out here on meetup or on email!

Looking forward to see you,
GDG Cloud organizers

events.name: API Gateways and CI Tools - September Cloud meetup
events.description:
Hi everyone, we are happy to announce a new GDG Cloud meetup, join us for evening about new technologies and meet other people interested in cloud technologies üòÑ

Agenda
17:00-17:30 Doors open
17:30:17:35 Welcome
17:35-18:05 Three levels of API gateway sophistication - Michael Stenskj√¶r Christensen
18:05-18:35 Snack and drinks sponsored by Computas
18:35-19:05 Why serverless never really worked for me until now!
19:15-19:45 You?
20:00-20:30 Socializing and thanks for this time!

---

Title: Three levels of API gateway sophistication
Speaker: Michael Stenskj√¶r Christensen
Description: The API is the universal interaction medium in a world where still more computational work is distributed, tasks are outsourced to providers, and concerns are separated within an organization. But exposing your application to the big and wild internet can be difficult. In the presentation we go through three levels of API surface maturity and sophistication. We start with a very basic solution and move to sophisticated handling of authentication, monitoring, routing and different levels of user tiers for monetization. We will see how this is done by rolling our own security before moving on to Google Endpoints and finally going all-in with Apigee.

Title: Why serverless never really worked for me until now!
Speaker: Kevin Simper
Description: In this presentation I want to talk about how I have tried serverless many times but always had issues. I could see the potential but it was always difficult to see it end to end, and when you are busy to often end up defaulting to what you already know. Now Google has launched Cloud Run and it looks to be the perfect solution, but does such a solution exist? Come and hear how I approach serverless with Cloud Run, Cloud Build, Berglas, Cloud KMS and bazel.build

---

What is GDG Cloud Copenhagen?
It is a meetup group that is organized by the community and supported by Google sometimes with resources. We are a group that like to use Google Cloud platform and other cloud technologies. We also like to meet other like-minded and talk about how we can do things smarter.
https://developers.google.com/community/gdg/

Can I present something at the meetup?
Yes, you are very welcome to come and present your ideas/solutions. We really appreciate and actively promote talks that help the community to get a new look at something or see how something is used in other companies! Reach out here on meetup or on email!

Looking forward to see you,
Kevin, Mads, Michael

events.name: Serverless workshop with Cloud Run and Cloud Build
events.description:
Hi everyone!

In this workshop we are going to learn about Google Cloud new product called Cloud Run which was launched this year. It is a super interesting product that allows you to run any Docker container and you only pay for what you use! Meaning this is the perfect product for developers that are making new product, startups or even for side-projects!

Sign up here: https://ti.to/gdg-cloud-copenhagen/serverless-workshop-with-cloud-run-and-cloud-build

In this workshop we will start from scratch, build a simple application and then launch it on Cloud Run. Afterwards will we try to use Google Cloud - Cloud Build to build our app each time we make a commit. This would be continuous integration as each time we make a chance we ensure that everything is building and works. Lastly we will connect Cloud Build to Cloud Run so that each time we commit it will automatically deploy our latest chances. This is incredible powerful as we are able to deploy something with very little overhead and pay nearly nothing for something high value, keeping backend online at all times!

This workshop is non-profit and it costs 50 kroners to cover renting the room and for the drinks and food. All details will publish like this last workshop https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1uEPctiqXYL89QBnE9Ja6H5kHKuFkxuPd4N9E78UBfQ8/edit#gid=0

Schedule:
17:00 Doors Open
17:30 Welcome
17:40 What is serverless and Cloud Run?
18:00 Exercises with Cloud Run
18:30 Sandwiches and drinks
18:50 Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment with Cloud Build
19:10 Exercises with Cloud Build
20:30 Follow up talk and networking!

Before the workshop it would be best if you signed up for Google Cloud. It is free and will not cost you anything monthly, but it takes a few minutes as you have to confirm your mobile number.

Who is behind and why?
My name is Kevin, I like organizing meetups and workshops and teaching. I think that Cloud Run and Cloud Build are such cool tools for any developers that I think more people will benefit of knowing them. I think that the best way to learn is hands-on and having somebody to help just for a second over the shoulder when something doesn‚Äôt work is the best. Also being productive and feeling productive is one thing that makes me very happy each day and those tools contribute to that üòÑ

Where can I read more about Cloud Run?
Yes, you can read more about Cloud Run here https://cloud.google.com/run/ Our community friend Martin Omander has also made this cool series on youtube about Serverless Toolbox, they are pretty funny https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLIivdWyY5sqKiWvnaA5A8F3UQ0Xu5i49U
I also have two talks about serverless and cloud run that shows a bit what we are going to go through:
How Cloud Run is the final destination in my Cloud Native journey https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oY9Mv9PHu7U
Why serverless never really worked for me until now! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=viGxI22fOuo

Best regards Kevin

If you have any questions please reach out to me either here or on mail. [masked]

Remember to sign up on the link here: https://ti.to/gdg-cloud-copenhagen/serverless-workshop-with-cloud-run-and-cloud-build

events.name: Getting started with DevOps - Cloud Build - November Meetup
events.description:
Hello everybody.
We are happy to be hosted by Karnov üòÑ and this time we will get all loaded up on more tools and approaches to CI and DevOps on GCP. DevOps is popular, but to get up and running we need both the right tools, but just as importantly also a right approach to how development work is done. This evening we will get both.

Agenda
17:00-17:50 Doors open
17:50:18:00 Welcome
18:00-18:40 Cloud Build & Triggers-as-code ‚Äì Mads S√∏rensen √òlsgaard
18:40-19:10 Snack and drinks
19:10-19:40 DevOps, the first two weeks - and what to do after that ‚Äì Daniel Grenner
19:40-20:10 Google Deployment Manager: The good, the bad and the ugly - Casper Fabricius
20:10-20:30 Socializing and thanks for this time!

----

DevOps, the first two weeks - and what to do after that ‚Äì Daniel Grenner

IKEA is undergoing a digital transformation, where one of the changes is that DevOps practices are being introduced in the product development teams. In this presentation you will see how we started our work in one of the teams. It goes into how (and why) we early started with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with Terraform, and Continuous Integration with Cloud Build. You will also hear some ways how to select in what order to introduce different DevOps practices and tools.

Cloud Build & Triggers-as-code ‚Äì Mads S√∏rensen √òlsgaard

This talk will go over how Cloud Build can be used for automating deployment of large applications on GCP and includes tips for building advanced pipelines and examples for how to manage all of Cloud Build as code in git.

Google Deployment Manager: The good, the bad and the ugly - Casper Fabricius

Infrastructure as code is the new black, and Google's product for IaC is called Deployment Manager. When Driversnote moved to Google Cloud in the beginning of 2019, we decided to go with Deployment Manager, and that proved to be a mixed bag of good, bad and ugly experiences. This talk will cover them all, and help you decide if Deployment Manager may be right for your IaC needs.

---

What is GDG Cloud Copenhagen?
It is a meetup group that is organized by the community and supported by Google sometimes with resources. We are a group that is like to use Google Cloud platform and meet like-minded and talk about how we can do things smarter.

Can I present something at the meetup?
Yes, you are very welcome to come and present your ideas/solutions. We really appreciate and actively promote talks that help the community to get a new look at something or see how something is used in other companies! Reach out here on meetup or on email!

Looking forward to see you,
GDG Cloud organizers
Michael & Kevin

events.name: February Cloud Meetup
events.description:
Hi everyone,
We are ready again for another GDG Cloud meetup. A lot of things to talk about this year, cloud continues to make a lot of things easier.

We are also seeing some people fight back against complexity, Kelsey Hightower talks about not using microservice architecture if it is not a proper seperation. https://changelog.com/posts/monoliths-are-the-future Google Cloud also just launched Secret Manager, something very relevant from what we have talked about last year, security should be easy and first priority https://cloud.google.com/blog/products/identity-security/introducing-google-clouds-secret-manager
Kubecon and CloudNativeCon Europe is also soon, March 30 ‚Äì April 2 https://events.linuxfoundation.org/kubecon-cloudnativecon-europe/ and Google Cloud Next in San Francisco is April 6 - April 8

We are pretty excited about 2020!

Agenda:
17:00-17:30 Doors open
17:30:17:35 Welcome
17:35-18:05 Real time data processing with DataFlow (with new SQL transformations) - Iva Marusic
18:05-18:35 Snack and drinks sponsored by Syntio
18:35-19:05 Kubernetes Architecture deepdive - How does components interact? - Victor Zanabria
19:15-19:45 BigTable - How to design a distributed storage system - Tobias Karlsson
20:00-20:30 Socializing and thanks for this time!

What is GDG Cloud Copenhagen?
It is a meetup group that is organized by the community and supported by Google sometimes with resources. We are a group that is like to use Google Cloud platform and meet like-minded and talk about how we can do things smarter.

Can I present something at the meetup?
Yes, you are very welcome to come and present your ideas/solutions. We really appreciate and actively promote talks that help the community to get a new look at something or see how something is used in other companies! Reach out here on meetup or on email!

Looking forward to see you,
GDG Cloud organizers
Michael & Kevin

group_profile.intro: My name is Kevin and I like to build stuff and snowboarding.
